description: Flags when a population begins to exhibit apathy, compliance, or helplessness—due to fear, trauma, or long-term disempowerment. Detects collective erosion of action.

variables.D(t): Mass deferral language (e.g. 'they’ll fix it', 'nothing we can do')
variables.A(t): Cultural authority weight (narratives of helplessness or futility)
variables.C(t): Collective capacity signals (mutual aid, protest, creativity)

response: When we forget we can act, we lose more than power—we lose ourselves. Restore storylines of resistance, community invention, and local action. Agency is cultural memory.
